items.name: Ancient Fruit
items.description: It's been dormant for eons.

items.name: Apple
items.description: A crisp fruit used for juice and cider.

items.name: Apricot
items.description: A tender little fruit with a rock-hard pit.

items.name: Banana
items.description: A sweet, starchy tropical fruit.

items.name: Blackberry
items.description: An early-fall treat.

items.name: Cactus Fruit
items.description: The sweet fruit of the prickly pear cactus.

items.name: Cherry
items.description: It's popular, and ripens sooner than most other fruits.

items.name: Coconut
items.description: A seed of the coconut palm. It has many culinary uses.

items.name: Cranberries
items.description: These tart red berries are a traditional winter food.

items.name: Crystal Fruit
items.description: A delicate fruit that pops up from the snow.

items.name: Grape
items.description: A sweet cluster of fruit.

items.name: Hot Pepper
items.description: Fiery hot with a hint of sweetness.

items.name: Mango
items.description: A big, sweet tropical fruit with a unique flavor.

items.name: Melon
items.description: A cool, sweet summer treat.

items.name: Orange
items.description: Juicy, tangy, and bursting with sweet summer aroma.

items.name: Peach
items.description: It's almost fuzzy to the touch.

items.name: Pineapple
items.description: A sweet and tangy tropical treat.

items.name: Pomegranate
items.description: Within the fruit are clusters of juicy seeds.

items.name: Powdermelon
items.description: Named for the powdery coating that forms on the surface, this melon is crisp and sweet, with a delicate flavor.

items.name: Qi Fruit
items.description: Mr. Qi has challenged you to ship 500 of these strange melons.

items.name: Rhubarb
items.description: The stalks are extremely tart, but make a great dessert when sweetened.

items.name: Salmonberry
items.description: A spring-time berry with the flavor of the forest.

items.name: Spice Berry
items.description: It fills the air with a pungent aroma.

items.name: Starfruit
items.description: An extremely juicy fruit that grows in hot, humid weather. Slightly sweet with a sour undertone.

items.name: Strawberry
items.description: A sweet, juicy favorite with an appealing red color.

items.name: Wild Plum
items.description: Tart and juicy with a pungent aroma.

items.name: Blue Jazz
items.description: The flower grows in a sphere to invite as many butterflies as possible.

items.name: Carrot
items.description: A fast-growing, colorful tuber that makes for a great snack.

items.name: Cauliflower
items.description: Valuable, but slow-growing. Despite its pale color, the florets are packed with nutrients.

items.name: Garlic
items.description: Adds a wonderful zestiness to dishes. High quality garlic can be pretty spicy.

items.name: Kale
items.description: The waxy leaves are great in soups and stir fries.

items.name: Parsnip
items.description: A spring tuber closely related to the carrot. It has an earthy taste and is full of nutrients.

items.name: Potato
items.description: A widely cultivated tuber.

items.name: Tulip
items.description: The most popular spring flower. Has a very faint sweet smell.

items.name: Unmilled Rice
items.description: Rice in its rawest form. Run this through a mill to increase the value.

items.name: Rice
items.description: A basic grain often served under vegetables.

items.name: Poppy
items.description: In addition to its colorful flower, the Poppy has culinary and medicinal uses.

items.name: Radish
items.description: A crisp and refreshing root vegetable with hints of pepper when eaten raw.

items.name: Red Cabbage
items.description: Often used in salads and coleslaws. The color can range from purple to blue to green-yellow depending on soil conditions.

items.name: Summer Spangle
items.description: A tropical bloom that thrives in the humid summer air. Has a sweet, tangy aroma.

items.name: Sunflower
items.description: A common misconception is that the flower turns so it's always facing the sun.

items.name: Wheat
items.description: One of the most widely cultivated grains. Makes a great flour for breads and cakes.

items.name: Amaranth
items.description: A purple grain cultivated by an ancient civilization.

items.name: Artichoke
items.description: The bud of a thistle plant. The spiny outer leaves conceal a fleshy, filling interior.

items.name: Beet
items.description: A sweet and earthy root vegetable. As a bonus, the leaves make a great salad.

items.name: Bok Choy
items.description: The leafy greens and fibrous stalks are healthy and delicious.

items.name: Fairy Rose
items.description: An old folk legend suggests that the sweet smell of this flower attracts fairies.

items.name: Pumpkin
items.description: A fall favorite, grown for its crunchy seeds and delicately flavored flesh. As a bonus, the hollow shell can be carved into a festive decoration.

items.name: Yam
items.description: A starchy tuber with a lot of culinary versatility.

items.name: Taro Root
items.description: This starchy root is one of the most ancient crops.

items.name: Sweet Gem Berry
items.description: It's by far the sweetest thing you've ever smelled.

items.name: Egg
items.description: A regular white chicken egg.

items.name: Large Egg
items.description: It's an uncommonly large white egg!

items.name: Duck Egg
items.description: It's still warm.

items.name: Milk
items.description: A jug of cow's milk.

items.name: Large Milk
items.description: A large jug of cow's milk.

items.name: Goat Milk
items.description: The milk of a goat.

items.name: Large Goat Milk
items.description: A gallon of creamy goat's milk.

items.name: Truffle
items.description: A gourmet type of mushroom with a unique taste.

items.name: Honey
items.description: It's a sweet syrup produced by bees. (Wild Honey assumed)

items.name: Hops
items.description: A bitter, tangy flower used to flavor beer.

items.name: Vinegar
items.description: An aged fermented liquid used in many cooking recipes.
